channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: DHS keeps making false claims about people. It's part of a broader pattern
item.description: Trump administration officials have falsely linked Alex Pretti and Renee Macklin Good to domestic terrorism. It's part of a larger pattern by the Department of Homeland Security.
item.content:encoded:
Trump administration officials have falsely linked Alex Pretti and Renee Macklin Good to domestic terrorism. It's part of a larger pattern by the Department of Homeland Security.

(Image credit: Al Drago)
item.dc:creator: Jude Joffe-Block

item.title: Photos: Thousands once again protest ICE in Minneapolis and across the U.S.
item.description: Demonstrators in Minneapolis and other U.S. cities participated in protests as part of a "national shutdown" to end immigration enforcement operations.
item.content:encoded:
Demonstrators in Minneapolis and other U.S. cities participated in protests as part of a "national shutdown" to end immigration enforcement operations.

(Image credit: Jaida Grey Eagle for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Danielle A. Scruggs

item.title: Judge rules Luigi Mangione should not face death penalty
item.description: A federal judge dropped two of the charges against Luigi Mangione — the man accused of fatally shooting UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson — making his case no longer eligible for the death penalty.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge dropped two of the charges against Luigi Mangione — the man accused of fatally shooting UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson — making his case no longer eligible for the death penalty.

(Image credit: Curtis Means)
item.dc:creator: Sarah Ventre

item.title: Minnesota corrections commissioner disputes ICE arrest numbers
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Paul Schnell, commissioner of the Minnesota Department of Corrections, over his agency's dispute of Homeland Security claims around arrest numbers.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Paul Schnell, commissioner of the Minnesota Department of Corrections, over his agency's dispute of Homeland Security claims around arrest numbers.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Hodges

item.title: States look at banning masked agents, but local police have doubts
item.description: We look at the potential for conflict between local police and federal immigration agents as Democratic states consider banning law enforcement from wearing masks or otherwise concealing their IDs.
item.content:encoded: We look at the potential for conflict between local police and federal immigration agents as Democratic states consider banning law enforcement from wearing masks or otherwise concealing their IDs.
item.dc:creator: Martin Kaste

item.title: Blue Origin pauses space tourism flights to focus on lunar lander
item.description: Blue Origin, owned by billionaire Jeff Bezos, says it's stopping human spaceflights for at least two years. The move will allow it to "shift resources" to the company's lunar landing capabilities.
item.content:encoded:
Blue Origin, owned by billionaire Jeff Bezos, says it's stopping human spaceflights for at least two years. The move will allow it to "shift resources" to the company's lunar landing capabilities.

(Image credit: Patrick T. Fallon)
item.dc:creator: Brendan Byrne

item.title: How the George Floyd killing changed Minneapolis gun culture
item.description: Interest in firearms for self-defense has grown on the left in Minneapolis. The labeling of an armed resident who was shot while filming ICE activity as a "domestic terrorist" has some reconsidering.
item.content:encoded: Interest in firearms for self-defense has grown on the left in Minneapolis. The labeling of an armed resident who was shot while filming ICE activity as a "domestic terrorist" has some reconsidering.
item.dc:creator: Odette Yousef

item.title: Texas A&M University cancels programs in women's and gender studies
item.description: The university said it had also modified hundreds of courses and cancelled six in efforts to eliminate teaching related to diversity, equity and inclusion.
item.content:encoded:
The university said it had also modified hundreds of courses and cancelled six in efforts to eliminate teaching related to diversity, equity and inclusion.

(Image credit: Jay Janner)
item.dc:creator: Elissa Nadworny

item.title: How American Katie Uhlaender was denied Olympic bid by Canadian coach's point scheme
item.description: Sports officials say a Canadian coach manipulated the point system used by athletes to qualify for the Olympics. His move cost American sled racer Katie Uhlaender her trip to the Milan Cortina Games.
item.content:encoded:
Sports officials say a Canadian coach manipulated the point system used by athletes to qualify for the Olympics. His move cost American sled racer Katie Uhlaender her trip to the Milan Cortina Games.

(Image credit: Odd Andersen)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Alex Pretti shooting by federal agents in Minneapolis prompts DOJ civil rights probe
item.description: Alex Pretti's shooting death by federal agents in Minneapolis has prompted a Department of Justice civil rights probe. Renee Macklin Good's death by federal agents has not.
item.content:encoded:
Alex Pretti's shooting death by federal agents in Minneapolis has prompted a Department of Justice civil rights probe. Renee Macklin Good's death by federal agents has not.

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: Brian Bakst
